member.name: T:ArcGIS.Desktop.TaskAssistant.GpEmbeddedView
member.summary: Interaction logic for GpEmbeddedView.xaml
GpEmbeddedView

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.TaskAssistant.GpEmbeddedView.InitializeComponent
member.summary: InitializeComponent

member.name: T:ArcGIS.Desktop.TaskAssistant.HtmlTokenType
member.summary: types of lexical tokens for html-to-xaml converter

member.name: T:ArcGIS.Desktop.TaskAssistant.HtmlLexicalAnalyzer
member.summary: lexical analyzer class recognizes tokens as groups of characters separated by arbitrary amounts of whitespace also classifies tokens according to type

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.TaskAssistant.HtmlLexicalAnalyzer.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: initializes the _inputStringReader member with the string to be read also sets initial values for _nextCharacterCode and _nextTokenType
member.param: text string to be parsed for xml content

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.TaskAssistant.HtmlLexicalAnalyzer.GetNextContentToken
member.summary: retrieves next recognizable token from input string and identifies its type if no valid token is found, the output parameters are set to null if end of stream is reached without matching any token, token type paramter is set to EOF

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.TaskAssistant.HtmlLexicalAnalyzer.GetNextTagToken
member.summary: Unconditionally returns a token which is one of: TagEnd, EmptyTagEnd, Name, Atom or EndOfStream Does not guarantee token reader advancing.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.TaskAssistant.HtmlLexicalAnalyzer.GetNextEqualSignToken
member.summary: Unconditionally returns equal sign token. Even if there is no real equal sign in the stream, it behaves as if it were there. Does not guarantee token reader advancing.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.TaskAssistant.HtmlLexicalAnalyzer.GetNextAtomToken
member.summary: Unconditionally returns an atomic value for an attribute Even if there is no appropriate token it returns Atom value Does not guarantee token reader advancing.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.TaskAssistant.HtmlLexicalAnalyzer.GetNextCharacter
member.summary: Advances a reading position by one character code and reads the next availbale character from a stream. This character becomes available as NextCharacter property.
member.remarks: Throws InvalidOperationException if attempted to be called on EndOfStream condition.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.TaskAssistant.HtmlLexicalAnalyzer.SkipWhiteSpace
member.summary: skips whitespace in the input string leaves the first non-whitespace character available in the NextCharacter property this may be the end-of-file character, it performs no checking

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.TaskAssistant.HtmlLexicalAnalyzer.IsGoodForNameStart(System.Char)
member.summary: checks if a character can be used to start a name if this check is true then the rest of the name can be read
member.param: character value to be checked
member.returns: true if the character can be the first character in a name false otherwise

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.TaskAssistant.HtmlLexicalAnalyzer.IsGoodForName(System.Char)
member.summary: checks if a character can be used as a non-starting character in a name uses the IsExtender and IsCombiningCharacter predicates to see if a character is an extender or a combining character
member.param: character to be checked for validity in a name
member.returns: true if the character can be a valid part of a name

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.TaskAssistant.HtmlLexicalAnalyzer.IsCombiningCharacter(System.Char)
member.summary: identifies a character as being a combining character, permitted in a name TODO: only a placeholder for now but later to be replaced with comparisons against the list of combining characters in the XML documentation
member.param: character to be checked
member.returns: true if the character is a combining character, false otherwise

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.TaskAssistant.HtmlLexicalAnalyzer.IsExtender(System.Char)
member.summary: identifies a character as being an extender, permitted in a name TODO: only a placeholder for now but later to be replaced with comparisons against the list of extenders in the XML documentation
member.param: character to be checked
member.returns: true if the character is an extender, false otherwise

member.name: T:ArcGIS.Desktop.TaskAssistant.HtmlSchema
member.summary: HtmlSchema class maintains static information about HTML structure can be used by HtmlParser to check conditions under which an element starts or ends, etc.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.TaskAssistant.HtmlSchema.#cctor
member.summary: static constructor, initializes the ArrayLists that hold the elements in various sub-components of the schema e.g _htmlEmptyElements, etc.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.TaskAssistant.HtmlSchema.IsEmptyElement(System.String)
member.summary: returns true when xmlElementName corresponds to empty element
member.param: string representing name to test

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.TaskAssistant.HtmlSchema.IsBlockElement(System.String)
member.summary: returns true if xmlElementName represents a block formattinng element. It used in an algorithm of transferring inline elements over block elements in HtmlParser

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.TaskAssistant.HtmlSchema.IsInlineElement(System.String)
member.summary: returns true if the xmlElementName represents an inline formatting element

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.TaskAssistant.HtmlSchema.IsKnownOpenableElement(System.String)
member.summary: It is a list of known html elements which we want to allow to produce bt HTML parser, but don'tt want to act as inline, block or no-scope. Presence in this list will allow to open elements during html parsing, and adding the to a tree produced by html parser.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.TaskAssistant.HtmlSchema.ClosesOnParentElementEnd(System.String)
member.summary: returns true when xmlElementName closes when the outer element closes this is true of elements with optional start tags
member.param: string representing name to test

members.member:
returns true if the current element closes when the new element, whose name has just been read, starts
string representing current element name
string representing name of the next element that will start

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.TaskAssistant.HtmlSchema.IsEntity(System.String)
member.summary: returns true if the string passed as argument is an Html entity name
member.param: string to be tested for Html entity name

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.TaskAssistant.HtmlSchema.EntityCharacterValue(System.String)
member.summary: returns the character represented by the entity name string which is passed as an argument, if the string is an entity name as specified in _htmlCharacterEntities, returns the character value of 0 otherwise
member.param: string representing entity name whose character value is desired

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.TaskAssistant.HtmlSchema.InitializeEmptyElements
member.summary: initializes _htmlEmptyElements with empty elements in HTML 4 spec at http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-html40/index/elements.html

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.TaskAssistant.HtmlSchema.InitializeElementsClosingOnParentElementEnd
member.summary: initializes _htmlElementsClosingOnParentElementEnd with the list of HTML 4 elements for which closing tags are optional we assume that for any element for which closing tags are optional, the element closes when it's outer element (in which it is nested) does

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.TaskAssistant.HtmlSchema.InitializeHtmlCharacterEntities
member.summary: initializes _htmlCharacterEntities hashtable with the character corresponding to entity names

member.name: T:ArcGIS.Desktop.TaskAssistant.HtmlParser
member.summary: HtmlParser class accepts a string of possibly badly formed Html, parses it and returns a string of well-formed Html that is as close to the original string in content as possible

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.TaskAssistant.HtmlParser.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructor. Initializes the _htmlLexicalAnalayzer element with the given input string
member.param: string to parsed into well-formed Html

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.TaskAssistant.HtmlParser.ParseHtml(System.String)
member.summary: Instantiates an HtmlParser element and calls the parsing function on the given input string
member.param: Input string of pssibly badly-formed Html to be parsed into well-formed Html

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.TaskAssistant.HtmlParser.ExtractHtmlFromClipboardData(System.String)
member.summary: Extracts Html string from clipboard data by parsing header information in htmlDataString
member.param: String representing Html clipboard data. This includes Html header
member.returns: String containing only the Html data part of htmlDataString, without header

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.TaskAssistant.HtmlParser.AddHtmlClipboardHeader(System.String)
member.summary: Adds Xhtml header information to Html data string so that it can be placed on clipboard
member.param: Html string to be placed on clipboard with appropriate header
member.returns: String wrapping htmlString with appropriate Html header

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.TaskAssistant.HtmlParser.ParseHtmlContent
member.summary: Parses the stream of html tokens starting from the name of top-level element. Returns XmlElement representing the top-level html element

member.name: T:ArcGIS.Desktop.TaskAssistant.HtmlToXamlConverter
member.summary: HtmlToXamlConverter is a static class that takes an HTML string and converts it into XAML

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.TaskAssistant.HtmlToXamlConverter.ConvertHtmlToXaml(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Converts an html string into xaml string.
member.param: Input html which may be badly formated xml.
member.returns: Well-formed xml representing XAML equivalent for the input html string.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.TaskAssistant.HtmlToXamlConverter.GetAttribute(System.Xml.XmlElement,System.String)
member.summary: Returns a value for an attribute by its name (ignoring casing)
member.param: XmlElement in which we are trying to find the specified attribute
String representing the attribute name to be searched for

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.TaskAssistant.HtmlToXamlConverter.UnQuote(System.String)
member.summary: Returns string extracted from quotation marks
member.param: String representing value enclosed in quotation marks

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.TaskAssistant.HtmlToXamlConverter.AddBlock(System.Xml.XmlElement,System.Xml.XmlNode,System.Collections.Hashtable,ArcGIS.Desktop.TaskAssistant.CssStylesheet,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Xml.XmlElement})
member.summary:
Analyzes the given htmlElement expecting it to be converted into some of xaml Block elements and adds the converted block to the children collection of xamlParentElement.
Analyzes the given XmlElement htmlElement, recognizes it as some HTML element and adds it as a child to a xamlParentElement. In some cases several following siblings of the given htmlElement will be consumed too (e.g. LIs encountered without wrapping UL/OL, which must be collected together and wrapped into one implicit List element).
member.param: Parent xaml element, to which new converted element will be added
Source html element subject to convert to xaml.
Properties inherited from an outer context.
member.returns: Last processed html node. Normally it should be the same htmlElement as was passed as a paramater, but in some irregular cases it could one of its following siblings. The caller must use this node to get to next sibling from it.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.TaskAssistant.HtmlToXamlConverter.AddList(System.Xml.XmlElement,System.Xml.XmlElement,System.Collections.Hashtable,ArcGIS.Desktop.TaskAssistant.CssStylesheet,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Xml.XmlElement})
member.summary: Converts Html ul or ol element into Xaml list element. During conversion if the ul/ol element has any children that are not li elements, they are ignored and not added to the list element
member.param: XmlElement representing Xaml parent to which the converted element should be added
XmlElement representing Html ul/ol element to be converted
properties inherited from parent context

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.TaskAssistant.HtmlToXamlConverter.AddOrphanListItems(System.Xml.XmlElement,System.Xml.XmlElement,System.Collections.Hashtable,ArcGIS.Desktop.TaskAssistant.CssStylesheet,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Xml.XmlElement})
member.summary: If li items are found without a parent ul/ol element in Html string, creates xamlListElement as their parent and adds them to it. If the previously added node to the same xamlParentElement was a List, adds the elements to that list. Otherwise, we create a new xamlListElement and add them to it. Elements are added as long as li elements appear sequentially. The first non-li or text node stops the addition.
member.param: Parent element for the list
Start Html li element without parent list
Properties inherited from parent context
member.returns: XmlNode representing the first non-li node in the input after one or more li's have been processed.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.TaskAssistant.HtmlToXamlConverter.AddListItem(System.Xml.XmlElement,System.Xml.XmlElement,System.Collections.Hashtable,ArcGIS.Desktop.TaskAssistant.CssStylesheet,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Xml.XmlElement})
member.summary: Converts htmlLIElement into Xaml ListItem element, and appends it to the parent xamlListElement
member.param: XmlElement representing Xaml List element to which the converted td/th should be added
XmlElement representing Html li element to be converted
Properties inherited from parent context

XmlElement reprsenting the Html table element to be converted
Hashtable representing properties inherited from parent context.

member.summary: Processes the information about table columns - COLGROUP and COL html elements.
member.param: XmlElement representing a source html table.
XmlElement repesenting a resulting xaml table.

Array of doubles - column start coordinates. Can be null, which means that column size information is not available and we must use source colgroup/col information. In case wneh it's not null, we will ignore source colgroup/col information.

XmlElement representing the first tr child of the tbody element to be read
Hashtable representing current properties of the tbody element that are generated and applied in the AddTable function; to be used as inheritedProperties when adding tr elements
member.returns: XmlNode representing the current position of the iterator among tr elements

member.summary: Adds TableCell elements to xamlTableRowElement.

XmlElement representing the child of tr or tbody element from which we should start adding td elements
properties of the current html tr element to which cells are to be added

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.TaskAssistant.HtmlToXamlConverter.AddDataToTableCell(System.Xml.XmlElement,System.Xml.XmlNode,System.Collections.Hashtable,ArcGIS.Desktop.TaskAssistant.CssStylesheet,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Xml.XmlElement})
member.summary: adds table cell data to xamlTableCellElement

XmlElement representing the start element of data to be added to xamlTableCellElement
Current properties for the html td/th element corresponding to xamlTableCellElement

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.TaskAssistant.HtmlToXamlConverter.AnalyzeTableStructure(System.Xml.XmlElement,ArcGIS.Desktop.TaskAssistant.CssStylesheet)
member.summary: Performs a parsing pass over a table to read information about column width and rowspan attributes. This information is used to determine the starting point of each column.
member.param: XmlElement representing Html table whose structure is to be analyzed
member.returns: ArrayList of type double which contains the function output. If analysis is successful, this ArrayList contains all the points which are the starting position of any column in the table, ordered from left to right. In case if analisys was impossible we return null.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.TaskAssistant.HtmlToXamlConverter.AnalyzeTbodyStructure(System.Xml.XmlElement,System.Collections.ArrayList,System.Collections.ArrayList,System.Double,ArcGIS.Desktop.TaskAssistant.CssStylesheet)
member.summary: Performs a parsing pass over a tbody to read information about column width and rowspan attributes. Information read about width attributes is stored in the reference ArrayList parameter columnStarts, which contains a list of all starting positions of all columns in the table, ordered from left to right. Row spans are taken into consideration when computing column starts
member.param: XmlElement representing Html tbody whose structure is to be analyzed
ArrayList of type double which contains the function output. If analysis fails, this parameter is set to null

Current width of the table. This is used to determine if a new column when added to the end of table should come after the last column in the table or is actually splitting the last column in two. If it is only splitting the last column it should inherit row span for that column
member.returns: Calculated width of a tbody. In case of non-analizable column width structure return 0;

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.TaskAssistant.HtmlToXamlConverter.AnalyzeTRStructure(System.Xml.XmlElement,System.Collections.ArrayList,System.Collections.ArrayList,System.Double,ArcGIS.Desktop.TaskAssistant.CssStylesheet)
member.summary: Performs a parsing pass over a tr element to read information about column width and rowspan attributes.
member.param: XmlElement representing Html tr element whose structure is to be analyzed

ArrayList of type double which contains the function output. If analysis is successful, this ArrayList contains all the points which are the starting position of any column in the tr, ordered from left to right. If analysis fails, the ArrayList is set to null

ArrayList representing all columns currently spanned by an earlier row span attribute. These columns should not be used for data in this row. The ArrayList actually contains notation for all columns in the table, if the active row span is set to 0 that column is not presently spanned but if it is > 0 the column is presently spanned
Double value representing the current width of the table. Return 0 if analisys was insuccessful.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.TaskAssistant.HtmlToXamlConverter.GetRowSpan(System.Xml.XmlElement)
member.summary: Gets row span attribute from htmlTDElement. Returns an integer representing the value of the rowspan attribute. Default value if attribute is not specified or if it is invalid is 1
member.param: Html td element to be searched for rowspan attribute

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.TaskAssistant.HtmlToXamlConverter.GetNextColumnIndex(System.Int32,System.Double,System.Collections.ArrayList,System.Collections.ArrayList)
member.summary: Gets index at which a column should be inseerted into the columnStarts ArrayList. This is decided by the value columnStart. The columnStarts ArrayList is ordered in ascending order. Returns an integer representing the index at which the column should be inserted
member.param: Array list representing starting coordinates of all columns in the table
Starting coordinate of column we wish to insert into columnStart

Int representing the current column index. This acts as a clue while finding the insertion index. If the value of columnStarts at columnIndex is the same as columnStart, then this position alrady exists in the array and we can jsut return columnIndex.
